TITLE.P: 81224113 — Global Event Agency for the Leadership for Universal Health Coverage Program (L4UHC)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The global movement for Universal Health Coverage (UHC) seeks to ensure that people everywhere have access to the health services they need without fear of financial hardship. All countries have committed to the achievement of UHC as part of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

While there is widespread support for the idea of UHC, actually realizing UHC at country level is contentious. Key players and groups hold divergent interests, and technical efforts to advance reform often stall when these interests cannot be aligned. Skilled leadership is required to work through competing views, unite diverse groups behind a shared vision, and broker the trade-offs and compromises that are needed to keep complex UHC reform processes on track. The Leadership for Universal Health Coverage Program (L4UHC) was developed to address this challenge. It is implemented by the GIZ, the World Bank and WHO, in cooperation with the USAID, Expertise France and other partners within the P4H network.

GIZ seeks to contract a global event agency to support the implementation of L4UHC in Africa and Asia. This includes the organization of 15-22 events with up to 40 high-level stakeholders until September 2020. The 5-day events are attended by up to 40 participants from the participating countries. In addition to these participants, there is also a varying number of staff from development partners (approx. 10-15 people). The tasks will be:
1) To ensure the logistical implementation of all L4UHC activities through a global event manager;

The Global Event Agency will be responsible for the output of the logistics and event team, which includes, besides the Global Event Agency itself, the regional implementing organisms and any other sub-contracted agencies and consultants.
2) To provide project assistance for the L4UHC management at the GIZ Program UHC through a project assistant;
3) To contract leadership experts for all events and a UHC practitioner in Africa;
4) To sub-contract a regional implementing organization in Asia

The L4UHC Program is a highly complex multi-stakeholder endeavor. The global event agency will carry out all activities in close coordination and cooperation with the Global L4UHC Team and the larger team of facilitators, leadership and UHC experts as well as representatives of development partners.

3) should more than 5 bidders be eligible, the bids will be evaluated according to the following criteria and set percentage Points.
For the comparative evaluation we use the references and declarations submitted by the bidders:
a. Event management in complex multi-stakeholder environments: 40%;
d. Experience with GIZ and other development organizations, e.g. World Bank, who and others: 10%;

2) declaration on the personal situation of the applicant or the member of the consortium, consisting of:
a) declaration on the absence of the mandatory grounds of exclusion as per section 123 Act against Restraintsof Competition (Competition Act — GWB) or on the remedial actions and the measures;

(2) declaration on the employees of the applicant or the member of the consortium as of 31.12.2017.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: For (1) at least 500 000 EUR for the applicant or the consortium.
For (2) at least 10 employees for the applicant or the consortium.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: At least 6 reference projects in the technical field "events with at least 40 high-level participants" and at least 4 reference projects in the region World for the applicant or the consortium.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: According to Article 160, Section 3 of the German Act Against Restraint of Competition, application for re-examination is not permissible insofar as.

1. the applicant has identified the claimed infringement of the contract award regulations before submitting the application for re-examination and has not submitted a complaint to the commissioning party within a period of 10 calendar days; the expiry of the period pursuant to Article 134, Section 2 remains unaffected,

2. complaints of infringements of contract award regulations that are evident in the notice are not submitted to the commissioning party at the latest by the expiry of the deadline for the application specified in the notice or by the deadline for the submission of bids,

3. complaints of infringements of contract award regulations that first become evident in the tender documents are not submitted to the commissioning party at the latest by the expiry of the deadline for application or for the submission of bids,
4. more than 15 calendar days have elapsed after receipt of the notification from the commissioning party that it is unwilling to redress the complaint.

Sentence 1 does not apply in the case of an application to determine the invalidity of the contract in accordance with Article 135, Section 1 (2). Article 134, Section 1, Sentence 2 remains unaffected.
